ovdesc.p: This table allows overdraft limits to be specified for individual Accounts which can then be used as the limit for the first rate of debit interest specified in the appropriate Group Debit Interest condition.
If a Group Debit Interest condition record contains 2 rates, but no limit for the first rate, the overdraft limit specified for each Account in this table is used as the limit for the first rate.
In this way it is possible to specify a different limit for the first rate for each Account, without having to specify separate Account Debit Interest condition records.
If there is no limit specified in this table for a particular Account, a limit of zero is assumed, and the 2nd rate specified is effective for all balances.
Using this facility, it is not possible to specify more than 2 rates in the Group Debit Interest condition record.

The current record for an account may be updated/created automatically by the start of day processing. This is done when records currently exist for an account and the account record specifies that the limit on this record should be linked to the LIMITS file for the customers liability.

Specifies the Account for which the overdraft limit specified in LIMIT applies and the Date from which it applies.

If the appropriate Group Debit Interest condition record contains 2 debit interest rates and no limit is specified for the first, the overdraft limit specified in LIMIT of this record is used as the limit for the first rate when calculating Debit Interest on the Account specified in this field.
If an Account Debit Interest condition is specified for this Account (instead of using the Group condition), the overdraft limit specified in this record has no effect.
The corresponding CONCAT record in the file ACCOUNT.DATE will be updated.
